body.p: Which of the following is a true statement?

multiple_choice.choice: To connect to the Internet, a computer connects to a router and tells it what IP address will be used.
To connect to the Internet, a computer connects to its DHCP to determine its IP address.
To connect to the Internet, a computer connects to a router and is told what IP address to use.
To connect to the Internet, a computer connects to a router and waits until its desired IP address is available.

response.feedback: The router determines the IP address.
DHCP is a protocol, not a thing to connect to.
The router tells the computer what IP address to use.
Typically, the computer does not wait for a particular IP address; it uses whatever is available.
